sentences.en: ...a small ice-cream scoop.
sentences.cn: …一把小冰淇淋勺。

sentences.en: ...the sound of a spoon scooping dog food out of a can.
sentences.cn: …用勺子从罐子里舀狗粮的声音。

sentences.en: a journalist looking for a scoop
sentences.cn: 抢独家新闻的记者

sentences.en: All the newspapers really want to do is scoop the opposition.
sentences.cn: 所有报社真正想做的就是比对手抢先报道。

sentences.en: Cut the tomato in half and scoop out the seeds with a teaspoon.
sentences.cn: 把番茄切成两半，用茶匙把籽挖出。

sentences.en: Getting that story was the scoop of a lifetime for the journalist.
sentences.cn: 获得那个消息是这位记者终身难逢的独家新闻.

sentences.en: Halve the pineapple and scoop out the inside.
sentences.cn: 将菠萝对半切开，挖出里面的果肉。

sentences.en: He began to scoop his things up frantically.
sentences.cn: 他开始手忙脚乱地捡起他的东西。

sentences.en: He earned 2,000 pounds in one scoop.
sentences.cn: 他一下子赚两千英镑.

sentences.en: I used three scoops of flour and one ( scoop ) of sugar.
sentences.cn: 我用了三杓面粉和一 杓 糖.

sentences.en: In the morning he must get his boy to scoop it out.
sentences.cn: 早上一定得叫佣人把它剜出来.

sentences.en: Scoop out the rotten part of the pear.
sentences.cn: 把梨烂的地方剜掉.

sentences.en: Scoop the blanket weed out and use it to line hanging baskets.
sentences.cn: 把那些丝状水藻捞出来，垫在吊篮里。

sentences.en: She bent down and scooped up the little dog.
sentences.cn: 她弯腰抱起小狗。

sentences.en: She gave him an extra scoop of clotted cream.
sentences.cn: 她多给他加了一勺浓缩奶油。

sentences.en: She made a scoop with her hand and picked up what she had dropped.
sentences.cn: 她把手做成勺状抄起她掉下的东西.

sentences.en: The journalist's interest in a scoop and the source's self - interest coincide.
sentences.cn: 新闻工作者抢登内幕新闻的兴趣和消息来源的自身利益一致.

sentences.en: The newspaper got a scoop on the airplane crash.
sentences.cn: 该报独家报导了那次飞机失事.

sentences.en: Time and again we have scooped our rivals.
sentences.cn: 我们一再抢在对手之前登出报道。

sentences.en: Uh , one scoop of coffee and one scoop of chocolate for me.
sentences.cn: 我要一勺咖啡的和一勺巧克力的.

sentences.en: Use both hands to scoop up the leaves.
sentences.cn: 用双手捧起叶子。

words.tran_cn: 满满的一勺子；满满的一铲子

trans.tran_cn: 铲，勺，水舀，铲斗，一勺[铲]之量，穴，凹处，通气（或通水）口
trans.tran_en: an important or exciting news story that is printed in one newspaper or shown on one television station before any of the others know about it

trans.tran_cn: 舀出； 抢在之前报道新闻
trans.tran_en: to be the first newspaper to print an important news report

trans.tran_cn: 舀，挖空，掏，抓取，[非正式用语]抢先获得、发布
